p: Hydrogen peroxide content in rye shoots was determined according to [ 61]. The plant material was homogenized in trichloroacetic acid in an ice bath. The homogenate was centrifuged at 16,000Ã— g for 15 min. The supernatant was added to the reaction mixture containing 10 mM of phosphate buffer (pH 7.0) and 1 M of potassium iodine (KI). The mixture was incubated in the dark for 1 h. Optical absorbance was measured at 390 nm. Hydrogen peroxide content in the plant material was determined using a calibration graph and expressed in nmol H 2O 2 per gram dry weight.
